Dear Ms. Prudhomme:
Attached is the Interim Report for the above referenced facility completed on March 11,
2022. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract and
Modified Settlement Agreement (MISEP) requirements, a written corrective action plan is
required. It should be noted that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the
MSA and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica Vandenheuvel, at (616) 204-
6992.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except
for the following:
R 400.12324 Reevaluation
(8) An agency shall complete a reevaluation and shall make
a licensing recommendation to the department at least 15
calendar days before the expiration date of the foster home
license.
One of three foster home files reviewed did not have the reevaluation completed at
least 15 days prior to the expiration date of the foster home license as required.
File one: license expired on 1/5/2022 and the reevaluation was completed on
12/29/2021.
R 400.12212 Personnel records
(1) The personnel record shall contain all of the following
information before employment may occur:
(d) Three references obtained from persons who are
unrelated to the staff person.
One of six employee files reviewed did not have three references completed prior to
employment start date as required.
File one: Intern started on 9/3/2021 and one of three references obtained was
completed on 10/15/2021.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that
there are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1.
The facility is in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract violation. Please note
that there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS
Contract/Policy requirements except for the following:
ADM 330 Quarterly adoption progress reports
Adoption workers must submit written quarterly progress
reports every 90 days using the DHS-614, Quarterly
Adoption Progress Report.
4

Two of six adoption files reviewed did not have the quarterly adoption progress report
completed timely as required.
File one: Quarterly adoption progress report due on 9/9/2021 was completed on
9/19/2021.
Filed two: Quarterly adoption progress reports due on 4/5/2021, 6/21/2021, 9/20/2021,
10/28/2021 and 12/17/2021 were all completed on 12/20/2021.
FOM 722-06B FTM Documentation
The DHS-1105, FTM Report, must be completed for every FTM.
The caseworker must enter the FTM information in MiSACWIS
using the FTM hyperlink within seven business days of the FTM.
Five of six foster care files reviewed contained FTM’s without the DHS 1105 or the
DHS 1105 was not uploaded within seven business days.
FOM 722-06H Timely entry of case contacts
The caseworker must enter the required face-to-face
contacts listed below in MISACWIS within five business days
of the contact. This includes attempted and missed face-to-
face contacts.
Four of six foster care files reviewed contained contacts that were not entered within
five business days.

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care or child abuse
and/or neglect during this licensing period.
There was one incident of substantiated corporal punishment during this
licensing period.
A special evaluation initiated on 10/20/2021 determined the foster parent was
utilizing spanking as discipline. The foster parent was found to be in violation of
licensing rules and agency policy. As a result of the special evaluation findings the
agency has recommended revocation of the foster parent’s license.
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
The renewal inspection completed on 3/11/2021 with a corrective action plan
approved on 3/16/2021. During the review the agency had two violations. No
citations were noted as repeat violations in the current inspection. During this period
under review the agency expressed the impact that the COVID-19 pandemic had on
overall compliance. In addition, the agency noted that staff turnover and retention
impacted overall compliance.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The assessment reported the agency did not have any identified barriers to
achieving compliance over the most recent review period. The Chief Administrator
(CA) noted the previous year CAP was effective and the agency has good systems
in place. In addition, the CA noted the agency partners with two local DHHS offices
and their CQI teams which has had a significant impact over the past few years. The
CA indicated the agency has increased supervisor oversight partnered with
additional input from staff regarding data for key performance indicators. The CA
expressed confidence in the current systems in place.
Interviews
Interviews were conducted with three staff via telephone. Staff acknowledged the
agency has struggled during the review period with staff turnover. However, they
expressed confidence that staff retention will improve. Staff reported feeling
supported by supervisors as well as their peers and did not report any needs at this
time.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no identified safety concerns.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon
receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility
continue on a regular license.
